title: Abdul Aziz Tetteh
text:
Abdul Aziz Tetteh (born 25 May 1990) is a <a href="Ghana">Ghana</a>ian <a href="Football%20%28soccer%29">footballer</a> who currently plays as a <a href="defensive%20midfielder">defensive midfielder</a> for Polish club <a href="Widzew%20%C5%81%C3%B3d%C5%BA">Widzew Łódź</a>.
Career.
Tetteh began his career with Dansoman-based <a href="Liberty%20Professionals">Liberty Professionals</a>. He was an integral member of the <a href="Liberty%20Professionals%20F.C.">Liberty Pro.</a> team before signed with <a href="Udinese%20Calcio">Udinese Calcio</a> in January 2008. Tetteh left in summer 2008 <a href="Udinese%20Calcio">Udinese Calcio</a> and joined on loan with <a href="Xerez%20CD">Xerez</a> of the Spanish <a href="Segunda%20Divisi%C3%B3n">Segunda División</a>. After a year with <a href="Xerez%20CD">Xerez</a> he returned to <a href="Udinese">Udinese Calcio</a> which then loaned him to <a href="Granada%20CF">Granada</a>. After spending a few years out on loans he joined <a href="Platanias%20F.C.">Platanias</a> in 2013.
On 31 January 2018, he signed with the Russian club <a href="FC%20Dynamo%20Moscow">Dynamo Moscow</a>.
On 5 August 2019, Tetteh signed a three-year contract with Turkish <a href="S%C3%BCper%20Lig">Süper Lig</a> club <a href="Gazi%C5%9Fehir%20Gaziantep%20F.K.">Gazişehir Gaziantep</a>. After two seasons in Turkey, Tetteh returned to Poland, signing a one-year deal with <a href="Widzew%20%C5%81%C3%B3d%C5%BA">Widzew Łódź</a> on 23 July 2021, with an option to extend it for another two years.
International career.
He earned his first call-up in February 2008 for the local national team by French head coach <a href="Claude%20Le%20Roy">Claude Le Roy</a> for an <a href="African%20Nations%20Championship">African Nations Championship</a> match. In March 2008 was called from Head coach <a href="Sellas%20Tetteh">Sellas Tetteh</a> in the <a href="Ghana%20national%20under-20%20football%20team">Black Satellites</a> team.
Career statistics.
